STAMFIELD
Did Adam and Eve have belly buttons? :xbanghead
grayhawk

LOL! Ok, I'll bite.
 Since a belly button is created by the umbilicus being removed and the creation of Adam and Eve was not a birth by the traditional sense, and there was no umbilicus I would say no they did not have navels. :)
STAMFIELD
OK..THATS LOGICAL...AND I AGREE but...HOW DID EVE PRODUCE OFFSPRING?.. WITHOUT A NAVEL FOR THE FOETUS' UMBILICUS TO GROW FROM??? :xbanghead
grayhawk

emoticon_confused emoticon_confused A fetus' umbilical cord is attached to a placenta that develops in the womb, not from the mother's existing navel. Once the egg is fertilized a child and a placenta grows. With identical twins each has an umbilicus to the same placenta, with fraternal twins each has a seperate placenta and umbilicus.
 A placenta once birth occurs is expelled from the mother's womb. The placenta must be expelled or it can kill the mother. This was often the cause of death for the mother in history after a traumatic birth. (infection caused by the decay of the placenta if not expelled)
